item.title: 欧佩克连续第三个月下调全球石油需求增长预测
item.description: 石油输出国组织（OPEC）连续第三个月下调了今明两年的石油需求增长预测，因为该组织姗姗来迟地意识到全球燃料使用放缓。【原文：OPEC trimmed its forecasts for oil demand growth this year and next for a third consecutive month as the group belatedly recognizes a slowdown in global fuel use.】

item.title: 亚马逊在雅西时代减少大起大落，降低成本
item.description: 亚马逊最近在纳什维尔举行的会议传递了有关公司未来的信息。但首先...【原文：Amazon’s recent conference in Nashville delivered a message about the company’s future. But first...】

item.title: 美国银行将金融科技投资银行团队折叠为技术团队
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp. ）已将其金融科技投资银行团队并入其技术业务部门，这反映了整个行业在金融服务方面向软件的转变。【原文：Bank of America Corp. has folded its fintech investment banking team into its technology practice, reflecting the industrywide shift in financial services toward software.】

item.title: 科技明星鲍勃-李的被控凶手将向陪审团陈述自卫理由
item.description: 科技高管鲍勃-李（Bob Lee）在旧金山市中心的街道上被刺身亡的事件引起了全国的关注，一年半后，被指控杀害他的凶手即将出庭受审&mdash；他将辩称自己是出于自卫。【原文：One and a half years after the fatal stabbing of technology executive Bob Lee on a downtown San Francisco street drew nationwide attention, his accused killer is going on trial — and is set to argue he acted in self-defense.】

item.title: 英伟达乘着激烈的布莱克韦尔需求股价再创新高
item.description: 在 Nvidia 公司成功平息了投资者对产品延期及其长期增长前景的担忧之后，该公司的股价又开始飙升。【原文：Nvidia Corp.’s shares are roaring back after the company successfully calmed investor concerns about product delays and its long-term growth prospects.】

item.title: 法国考虑向 CD&R 出售赛诺菲集团的国有股份
item.description: 赛诺菲正在与美国收购公司 Clayton Dubilier & Rice 商谈出售其消费者保健业务的事宜，法国政府正在研究包括国有控股在内的各种方案，以保护法国的就业和生产。【原文：The French government is looking at options including taking a state holding in the consumer health business that Sanofi is in talks to sell to US buyout firm Clayton Dubilier & Rice, to protect jobs and production in France.】

item.title: S&P 公司称印度企业集团将在 10 年内斥资 8000 亿美元
item.description: 根据 S&P 全球评级公司（S&P Global Ratings）的数据，在未来 10 年内，印度企业集团将把资本支出增加近两倍，达到 8,000 亿美元，因为它们在追求增长的同时，也要让经济走向更加绿色的未来。【原文：Indian conglomerates are poised to nearly triple capital spending to $800 billion over the next 10 years from the previous decade, according to S&P Global Ratings, as they pursue growth while putting the economy on the path to a greener future.】

item.title: 欧盟支持制裁向俄罗斯提供导弹的伊朗
item.description: 欧盟支持针对伊朗向俄罗斯提供弹道导弹的一揽子制裁措施，其中包括限制伊朗航空公司和两家采购公司的措施。【原文：The European Union backed a package of sanctions targeting Iran for providing Russia with ballistic missiles, with measures including restrictions on Iran Air and two procurement firms.】

item.title: 印度称加拿大希望就锡克教调查询问高级外交官
item.description: 印度说，加拿大当局告诉它，印度驻渥太华的最高外交官是去年锡克教活动家谋杀案调查中的 "利益相关者"，这使两国政府之间的关系进一步紧张。【原文：India said it was told by Canadian authorities that its top diplomat in Ottawa is a “person of interest” in an investigation involving the murder of a Sikh activist last year, further straining ties between the two governments.】

item.title: 中国 9 月石油进口因利润率下降和维修而放缓
item.description: 由于炼油厂利润疲软，并按计划停产检修，中国上月石油进口量下降。【原文：Chinese oil imports fell last month as refiners grappled with weak margins and shut units for planned maintenance.】

item.title: 首席执行官和分析师对 S&P 500 的盈利前景看法不一
item.description: 本季度美国公司的利润前景出现了不寻常的分歧：虽然分析师下调了预测，但公司的指导意见却指出本季度将再创佳绩。【原文：There’s an unusual divergence in Corporate America’s profit outlook this season: while analysts have cut forecasts, company guidance points to another strong quarter.】

item.title: 莫里森寻求为 12 亿英镑杠杆贷款再融资
item.description: Morrisons 正在对 12 亿英镑（16 亿美元）的杠杆贷款进行再融资，因为这家英国杂货商希望利用投资者对高收益债务的强劲需求。【原文：Morrisons is refinancing £1.2 billion ($1.6 billion) in leveraged loans as the UK grocer looks to take advantage of stronger investor demand for higher-yielding debt.】

item.title: 据说 Cycle Pharma 将支持以 4.88 亿美元收购 Vanda
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，在旺达公司的一种药物未能获得监管部门批准后，Cycle Pharmaceuticals Ltd. 仍有意收购旺达制药公司（Vanda Pharmaceuticals Inc.【原文：Cycle Pharmaceuticals Ltd. is still interested in acquiring Vanda Pharmaceuticals Inc. after one of Vanda’s drugs failed to receive regulatory approval, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 雷诺、施特兰蒂斯看到电动汽车销售因价格下降而反弹
item.description: 据 Stellantis NV 和雷诺汽车公司称，随着插电式车型价格的下降，电动汽车的需求正显示出复苏的迹象。【原文：Demand for electric vehicles is showing signs of recovering as prices for plug-in models are coming down, according to Stellantis NV and Renault SA.】

item.title: 阿斯莫格鲁、约翰逊和罗宾逊荣获 2024 年诺贝尔经济学奖
item.description: 达龙-阿西莫格鲁、西蒙-约翰逊和詹姆斯-罗宾逊因研究制度如何形成并影响繁荣而获得诺贝尔经济学奖。【原文：Daron Acemoglu, Simon Johnson and James A. Robinson were awarded the Nobel Prize in economics for research into how institutions are formed and affect prosperity.】

item.title: 沙特 PIF 支持的公司计划建立贸易区以促进与中国的关系
item.description: 由沙特阿拉伯主权财富基金支持的投资公司 EWPartners 正计划在沙特境内开发一个所谓的经济特区，以促进中国与这个石油资源丰富的王国的贸易往来。【原文：EWPartners, an investment firm backed by Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund, is planning to develop a so-called special economic zone inside the country to boost Chinese trade with the oil-rich kingdom.】

item.title: 欧洲监管机构表示支持德国商业银行可能进行的交易
item.description: 几位中央银行和监管部门的高级官员表示，意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit SpA）对竞争对手德国商业银行（Commerzbank AG）的潜在收购很可能会获得监管部门的批准，并称几乎没有理由对该交易表示担忧。【原文：A potential takeover by UniCredit SpA of rival Commerzbank AG would likely get regulatory approval, several senior central bank and supervision officials indicated, saying there are few reasons why a deal should raise concerns.】

item.title: 中国信贷扩张超预期，但贷款额度不尽如人意
item.description: 在政府债券销售激增的帮助下，中国 9 月份的信贷扩张超出预期，但新增贷款却令人失望，这表明国内需求依然疲软。【原文：China’s credit expansion exceeded expectations in September, helped by a surge in government bond sales, while new loans disappointed in a sign of still weak domestic demand.】

item.title: 为什么 OpenAI 要与一个不知名的 "点子人 "开战？
item.description:

Guy Ravine’s Open AI (with a space) owns a trademark and website that OpenAI (no space) wants. What can their lawsuits tell us about the future of AI—and who wins in Silicon Valley?

item.title: 全球高管寻求保护免受大选引发的外汇波动影响
item.description: 距离投票日还有不到一个月的时间，美国总统大选可能会引发货币市场的动荡，这促使财务主管们加强公司的外汇套期保值。【原文：Less than a month from polling day, a toss-up US presidential election that could rattle currency markets is leading finance executives to bolster their companies’ foreign-exchange hedges.】

item.title: 地平线机器人公司据称将吸引阿里巴巴和百度作为首次公开募股的投资者
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，阿里巴巴集团控股有限公司和百度公司是地平线机器人公司（Horizon Robotics）在香港首次公开募股的基石投资者之一。【原文：Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. and Baidu Inc. are among the cornerstone investors in the Hong Kong initial public offering of Horizon Robotics, a Chinese provider of software and hardware used in autonomous driving systems, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 香港任命 Kelvin Wong 为市场监察机构主席
item.description: 香港任命 Kelvin Wong 为新任证券及期货事务监察委员会主席，任期三年。【原文：Hong Kong named Kelvin Wong as the new chairman of the Securities and Futures Commission for a three year-term.】

item.title: 土耳其公司中标承建中国避之唯恐不及的乌干达铁路
item.description: Yapi Merkezi Holdings AS 公司签署了在乌干达修建一条铁路线的协议，这有助于重振一个在中国撤资后努力寻找融资的项目。【原文：Yapi Merkezi Holdings AS signed a deal to build a railway line in Uganda, helping revive a project that struggled to find financing after China withdrew its support.】

item.title: 媒体报道称印尼下任总统召集可能的部长会议
item.description: 据当地电视台报道，印度尼西亚当选总统普拉博沃-苏比安托（Prabowo Subianto）在本月晚些时候举行就职典礼之前，于周一在其官邸召集部长候选人开会。【原文：Indonesia’s President-elect Prabowo Subianto called up ministerial candidates for a meeting at his residence on Monday, ahead of his inauguration later this month, according to local TV outlets.】

item.title: 陷入困境的电池制造商 Northvolt 缴纳税款，通过关键测试
item.description: 这家陷入困境的电池生产商发言人说，瑞典 Northvolt AB 公司周一支付了到期的税款，在该公司争相筹集更多资金之际，遵守了一个受到密切关注的最后期限。【原文：Sweden’s Northvolt AB paid a tax bill that fell due on Monday, a spokesman for the troubled battery maker said, meeting a closely watched deadline as the company scrambles to raise more funding.】

item.title: 铜业公司任命前高盛高管为首席执行官，进行战略调整
item.description: 加密货币托管公司 Copper Technologies Ltd. 已聘请前高盛集团董事总经理 Amar Kuchinad 接替 Dmitry Tokarev 担任集团首席执行官，该公司希望获得更多传统金融公司的客户，并进军美国市场。【原文：Crypto custodian Copper Technologies Ltd. has hired Amar Kuchinad, a former Goldman Sachs Group Inc. managing director, to replace Dmitry Tokarev as group CEO, as it looks to secure more traditional financial firms as clients and make inroads in the US market.】

item.title: 亚洲首次公开募股（IPO）银行家展望未来，本周募资 60 亿美元，走出中国市场低迷阴影
item.description: 本周，银行家们正在日本和印度筹备超过 60 亿美元的首次公开募股，在中国交易长期低迷的情况下，这两个市场已成为日益重要的收入来源，银行家们也因此得到了提振。【原文：Bankers are working on more than $6 billion of initial public offerings in Japan and India this week, getting a boost from two markets that have become an increasingly important revenue source amid a prolonged deal slump in China.】
